entry.RedBlue: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
entry.Yellow: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
entry.Gold: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
entry.Silver: Grains of sand trapped in its shells mix with its body fluids to form beautiful pearls.
entry.Crystal: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
entry.RubySapphire: At night, this POKéMON uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, SHELLDER closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
entry.FireRed: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
entry.LeafGreen: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
entry.Emerald: At night, it burrows a hole in the seafloor with its broad tongue to make a place to sleep. While asleep, it closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
entry.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entry.HeartGold: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
entry.SoulSilver: Grains of sand trapped in its shells mix with its body fluids to form beautiful pearls.
entry.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entry.X: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
entry.Y: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
entry.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
entry.Sun: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
entry.Moon: This Pokémon’s tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.

GoldSilver: Route 26, 27, New Bark Town, Olivine City, Pallet Town, Union Cave, Vermilion City
Crystal: Route 26, 27, New Bark Town, Pallet Town
FireRed: Cinnabar Island, Five Island, Icefall Cave, One Island, Pallet Town, Vermilion City
HeartGoldSoulSilver: Route 20, 21, 26, 27, 41, 47, Cinnabar Island, New Bark Town, Pallet Town, Vermilion City
Black 2White 2: Route 13, Undella Town, Humilau City, Seaside Cave
